document.title: Major changes between ISE Eiffel 5.6 and ISE Eiffel 5.7

toc.envision_location: EiffelEnvision\Introduction to EiffelEnvision\History and Known Issues\Compiler History

paragraph.heading: 2What's new
paragraph.seealso: See also: Differences between standard ECMA-367 and Eiffel Software implementation../../10_ise_eiffel_specific/ecma.xml
paragraph.heading: 2Improvements

list.item:
Improved memory management:
Ensure that if a block of allocated memory is not used it will eventually be freed. Before it will only be freed if it was the last allocated block.
Compaction is actually working. Before it was working if you had a lot of dead objects, now it will compact even if all you have is alive objects and that the memory is fragmented.
For large memory heap (i.e. larger than 1GB) improved speed of collections where there is a lot of dead objects.

Changed the way we search melted file, it is done in the following order:
Directory specified by environment parameter MELT_PATH
Current working directory
Directory where application is launched
Original directory where .melted file was generated the first time.

paragraph.heading: 2Changes

list.item: Implemented the new ECMA-367 specification for expanded. That is to say updated conformance and semantics rules.

paragraph.heading: 2Bug fixes

list.item: Fixed an issue with x2c if you had inlined C code which contains comments with single or double quote. Then it will not properly convert .x into .c file.

paragraph.heading: 3Language issues
3Compiler issues
3Runtime/code generation issues

list.item: Ensured that our runtime is async-safe for signals for all the runtime routines using some locking mechanisms.
Fixed a memory corruption issue in arycpy if a GC cycle was triggered as part of the processus of reallocating the SPECIAL object.

paragraph.heading: 3.NET issues

list.item: Removed limitation to inherit an Eiffel class which inherited from a .NET class.

paragraph.heading: 3Store/Retrieve issues

list.item: Fixed a memory leak in the recoverable retrieval when an exception is raised from a correct_mismatch routine call.
Fixed test#store008 regarding a crash when retrieving a type that does not exist in retrieved system.
